card.game
Class CardGame

java.lang.Object
  card.game.CardGame
Direct Known Subclasses:
PokerGame, WarGame
public abstract class CardGame
extends java.lang.Object

CardGame is the superclass for WarGame and PokerGame.
For the two games implemented the pattern for the game is simple:
1. Construct the game
a) identify the number of players
2. Initialize the game
a) shuffle the deck (optional for testing purposes)
b) deal cards to the players
3. Play the game as per its rules
4. Determine the winning hand

Field Summary

          deck of course is the deck of cards used for this instance of the game.

Field Detail

noOfPlayers

protected int noOfPlayers

players

protected java.util.ArrayList<Player> players
players is the list of player objects participating in the game. Although the number won't change during the course of the game it's best represented as a list.

hands

protected java.util.ArrayList<Hand> hands
hands represent the hands dealt to the players. Rather than make them instance variables of the player object it's better to have them as instance variables of the game object. This permits many games to be played in parallel on a multi-core machine. So hands is a "parallel" array to players.

deck

protected Deck deck
deck of course is the deck of cards used for this instance of the game.

Constructor Detail

CardGame

public CardGame(Player... players)

CardGame

protected CardGame(Deck deck,
                   Player... players)
This constructor is used for an artificially ordered deck

Parameters:
deck - - a deck in a specific order
players - - players in the game.
Method Detail

initialize

public abstract void initialize(boolean shuffle)
This method represents the initialization needed for a card game. For a random game "shuffle" should be true.

Parameters:
shuffle - - false means don't shuffle the deck before the deal. true means shuffle (randomize) the deck before the deal.

play

public abstract void play()
Play the game according to its rules.

getWinner

public abstract Player getWinner()
Determine the winner of the game.

Returns:
player (object) that won the game.
